title: Reinforcement Learning

definitions.Markov decision process: A set of states s in S, a set of actions (per state) A, a model T(s,a,s'), a reward function R(s,a,s')

summary: The slide discusses Reinforcement Learning, focusing on the Markov decision process (MDP) and the new twist of not knowing the transition and reward functions. It emphasizes the need to try out actions and states to learn.
